text:
It would be very useful if Ant's optional Microsoft Visual SourceSafe Tasks 
included the ability to create a new project and add file(s) to a project. 
These are supported at command-line in VSS version 6 via the following commands:

ss create $/myprojectname
ss add myfilename

Unfortunately, there is no committers using VSS so it would be nice if you were 
able to send a patch that allows this feature. Chance is that it will be 
reviewed much more quickly. Thanks.
creator: sbailliez@apache.org

Nightly build 2002-03-22 contains a vssadd task written by Nigel Magnay, could
you please look at it and see whether it has all the features you need?  If not,

It also contains a modified and untested version of your create task - I renamed

text:
I looked at the existing VSSADD task source by Nigel, and it should suffice for 
our needs, if it works. Could you give me some direction as to how I should 
produce the documentation/tests? I'm well versed in HTML, XML, and writing 
JUnit tests (assuming that's what is used) so I guess that I can do all of this 
if just given some help as how to get started. I don't have developer access to 
CVS, so I guess I would just post the documentation and tests here in bugzilla. 
If no unit tests are required (Nigel noted that his task had no test nor did 
the others), I will just post the documentation.

Thanks!
creator: Gary_Weaver@srspos.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
It was me who put the note about missing tests into the commit message 8-)

If you can supply us with JUnit tests, that would certainly be much appreciated.

As for documentation, pick up the latest version of
docs/manual/OptionalTasks/vss.html, modify it and create a patch (using
command line "diff -u" or "cvs diff -u" is preferred).

To create the patch, you don't need more than cvs read access, which is open to
the public.  If you are firewall challenged, you'll have to fall back to maintain
to copies of the file and use good old diff.
